title: 112_hr2524
content: The Act titled "Microenterprise Empowerment and Job Creation Act of 2011" aims to improve access to microenterprise for the very poor through amendments to the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to provide innovative approaches for the very poor to benefit from microfinance and microenterprise opportunities, particularly those unable to access financial services through the private sector. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to provide assistance for value chain interventions that benefit the very poor populations and are integral to the success of microfinance or microenterprise projects. Measures are included to ensure the sustainability of the value chain created or enhanced. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to provide assistance for value chain interventions that benefit the very poor populations and ensure sustainability. Administrative costs are clarified to exclude personnel costs related to training, mentoring, monitoring, and verifying project accountability. Targeted assistance provisions are also revised. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to prioritize 50% of microenterprise resources for very poor clients, including those without secure shelter, refugees, victims of trafficking, and vulnerable women. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 prioritizes assistance for vulnerable populations such as widows, orphans, and vulnerable children. Efforts are made to notify new program implementers, including faith-based and community-based organizations, about microenterprise opportunities for the very poor. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 prioritizes assistance for vulnerable populations like widows, orphans, and children. It includes a list of organizations providing assistance, poverty targets, and tools for identifying the very poor for microenterprise opportunities. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 prioritizes assistance for vulnerable populations like widows, orphans, and children. It includes tools for identifying the very poor for microenterprise opportunities and defines the requirements for accountability and transparency. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 prioritizes aid for vulnerable populations such as widows, orphans, and children. It includes measures for identifying the very poor for microenterprise opportunities and outlines accountability and transparency requirements. Additionally, the act defines the term 'value chain' as part of a market system for producing and delivering goods, including financing flow among actors. The act also adjusts the amount in subparagraph (B) of paragraph (15) from "$1" to "$1.25". SEC. 3. ENHANCED PROCUREMENT POLICIES FOR MICROFINANCE PROGRAMS. The Administrator shall develop a past performance system for future competitions and rules for conflicts of interest. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to authorize funds for HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis, and Malaria programs. Credit assistance amounts are specified for the same Act. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to authorize funds for HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis, and Malaria programs, with specified credit assistance amounts. Amendments include changing the time period from "2005 through 2009" to "2012 through 2016" and inserting "$2,070,000".
